Name: Amarillo
Descr: Floral, citrusy, similar to Cascade, but with a slightly higher alpha acid content.

Name: B. C. Goldings
Descr: B. C. Goldings: A classic flavor and aroma hop which many brewers reserve for their finest Bitter or Pale Ale recipes.  It also works well as a stand alone bittering hop.

Name: Bramling Cross
Descr: Started in 1927 from a Goldings female and a wild Manitoba male. Used as a general-purpose bittering hop, lately it has been used to provide a unique fruity, blackcurrant and lemon notes in traditional ales, especially in Christmas ales. Dry hopping can produce a very interesting effect. Bramling Cross is an under-appreciated hop.Alpha Acid: 5.0 to 7.0Storage: 60 to 70%Aroma: mild fruit, currantsUses: bittering and flavour/aromaSubstitutions: WGV, Progress, Kent Goldings

Name: Brewer's Gold
Descr: Brewer's Gold: Bittering and flavour hop used in Pete's Wicked Ale.

Name: Bullion
Descr: Bullion is considered a classic "Stout" hop.  Potent and spicy, it is best suited to bittering strong & dark Ales.

Name: Cascade
Descr: Cascade: Cascade, while a good bittering hop, is best known for its pronounced, very  distinctive "perfumey" aroma and flavor.  Used by many micro breweries.

Name: Centennial
Descr: Centennial: Centennial is a new, stronger and very aromatic Cascade variety.  Reserve Centennial  for bittering or use sparingly for aroma and flavor.

Name: Challenger
Descr: Challenger: One of the few recognized all-purpose hops combining moderate amounts of alpha acid with a good kettle aroma. Popular bittering hop used primarily in the UK. British ales and lagers.

Name: Challenger (Wye)
Descr: Challenger: One of the few recognized all-purpose hops combining moderate amounts of alpha acid with a good kettle aroma. Popular bittering hop used primarily in the UK. British ales and lagers.From the-home-brew-shop.co.uk (Feb 2002):Alpha Acid 6.5 - 7.5% Originally developed as a Goldings replacement, Challenger is a very versatile variety. Many brewers have found that excellent beers can be brewed from Challenger alone. It has fine bittering properties and a respectable aroma. More co

Name: Chinook
Descr: Chinook: A late U.S. hybrid along the line of Northern Brewer.  Chinook combines a solid, lingering bitterness with pronounced, spicy aromatic qualities.

Name: Cluster
Descr: Cluster: Excellent general purpose hop with medium and well-balanced bittering potential and no undesirable aroma properties. Good for Dark beers.

Name: Columbus
Descr: Columbus: Very pungent aroma, clean bittering properties.

Name: Crystal
Descr: Crystal: Known as a triploid, three hops contributing characteristics: Cascade, Brewer's Gold and Early Green.  Character is mild, pleasant, slightly spicy, used primarily as an aroma/finishing or flavour hop.

Name: E. Kent Goldngs
Descr: E. Kent Goldngs: A British grown version of the classic ale finishing hop.  Slightly smoother and more refined than the herbal, Canadian grown version.

Name: Eroica
Descr: Eroica: Eroica produces a very clean, solid bittering and a surprisingly pleasant flavor and aroma (when used sparingly) for an high alpha variety.

Name: Fuggles
Descr: Fuggles: Good all purpose ale hop. Well suited to bittering, flavoring and finishing.Will lend a pleasant hop profile, tending to be slightly fruity in aroma.

Name: Galena
Descr: Galena: A popular High Alpha Acid variety, Galena is a strong bittering hop which blends has a very clean flavour.  Blends well with other hops, especially nobel hops.

Name: Goldings
Descr: Goldings: A classic flavor and aroma hop which many brewers reserve for their finest Bitter or Pale Ale recipes.  It also works well as a stand alone bittering hop, and good for dry hopping pale ales & bitterFrom the-home-brew-shop.co.uk (Feb 2002):Alpha Acid 4.5 - 5.5% Originally grown in Kent and Surrey, the majority of Goldings are now produced in Worcestershire. The beautiful, flowery Goldings aroma is highly prized by brewers, but supplies are becoming harder to obtain due to poor y

Name: Hal. Hersbruckr
Descr: Hal. Hersbruckr: These German grown flower hops have a fine flavor & aroma. Use in your best Lagers.

Name: Hallertauer
Descr: Hallertauer: A versatile hop for most Lager/European/German beer styles.  Hallertau is a crisp bittering hop which also lends a pleasant, herbal aroma and flavor.

Name: Hallertauer Mittelfrueh
Descr: Pleasant, spicy, noble, mild herbal aroma

Name: Irish Moss
Descr: Add in last 10 min of boil

Name: Kent Goldings
Descr: Kent Goldings: Goldings are a prized flavor and aroma hop used by almost every Ale brewery in England to finish Bitters and Pale Ales -  grown in Kent, England.

Name: Liberty
Descr: Liberty: Another new Hallertau triploid, Liberty has an aroma profile similar to Hallertau Mittelfreuh. Liberty makes an excellent finishing  hop for Lagers.

Name: Mt. Hood
Descr: Mt. Hood: A new Hallertau variety developed in the U.S., Mt. Hood is High in aromatic oils, and is primarily used as an aroma or flavoring hop in Lagers.

Name: Northdown
Descr: Fruity with some spiciness.

Name: Northern Brewer
Descr: Northern Brewer: Northern Brewer is a versatile bittering hop for Ales, Porters and Stouts. While not considered an aroma hop it can be used to flavor Steam Beer recipes. German grown Northern Brewer will contribute a solid bittering and rich flavor to Ales and Lagers.

Name: Nugget
Descr: Nugget: A favorite of the high alpha hops, Nugget lends a clean, solid bitterness in moderate quantities yet also has a pleasant, herbal aromatic quality.

Name: Pacific Gem
Descr: A high alpha hop from New Zealand with a pleasant aroma. Pacific Gem can produce a cask oak flavour with distinct blackberry aroma, along with a woody character. Often available in North America and Europe as an organic hop, it has a reputation of having a smooth bitterness.  Pacific Gem has been used in several award-winning commercial ales and lagers.

Name: Pacific Gem Organic
Descr: Very high alpha hop with a pleasant citrus aroma good for bitters and dark beers. Some brewers have reported that Pacific Gem provides a subtle "blackberry" flavor/taste, which is a popular characteristic for English bitters and stouts

Name: Perle
Descr: Perle: A nice Hallertau/Northern Brewer cross.  Use as a bittering hop for many Lager varieties and, used sparingly, has a pleasant, green hop aroma.

Name: Polinischer Lublin
Descr: Polish grown hop of Saaz descent.  Refined, spicy arom, similar to Saaz.

Name: Pr. of Ringwood
Descr: Pr. of Ringwood: An Australian grown hop with a pungent, flowery flavor and crisp bittering. Popular among many brewers, it's an excellent Ale and Lager hop.

Name: Progress
Descr: Progress: While new to American brewers, Progress is an established and widely used Real Ale hop. Bred from the famous WGV, it has a pungent, fruity aroma.

Name: Runni
Descr: The most popular flavour hop in Russian beer. Unique hop grown in the Chuvash region, 800 km east of Moscow.Aroma: mild, spicy or woody aromaUses: flavour and aroma

Name: Saaz
Descr: Saaz: Having mild bittering power, it's the spicy, earthy, flavor and aroma that makes Saaz one of the worlds most prized Pilsner and Lager hops.

Name: Spalt
Descr: German hop used for bittering, flavour and armoa.  Common in Dusseldorf Altbiers.  Mild, pleasant, slightly spicey.

Name: Spalt Select
Descr: German hop used for bittering, flavour and armoa.  Common in Dusseldorf Altbiers.  Mild, pleasant, slightly spicey.

Name: Styrian Golding
Descr: Styrian Golding: A nice bittering hop with slightly spicy flavor and aroma characteristics.  Well suited to continental style Lagers and some Ales. Slovinian grown.

Name: Super Alpha
Descr: Described as reminiscent of European hops, this variety produces a clean, crisp flavor with a distinctive resin aroma.

Name: Super Styrians
Descr: These have a higher alpha content than regular Styrians. Rich full flavor similar to Northern brewers

Name: Talisman
Descr: Good all purpose hop with a fine, strong aroma. finer aroma than clusters. Good for light bodied beer.

Name: Target
Descr: Target: Widely used for high alpha acid content comined with an acceptable aroma. Robust bittering. British ales and lagers.

Name: Tettnanger
Descr: Tettnanger: While it can be used as a bittering hop, Tettnanger is an outstanding aroma hop, giving a rich and fragrant, almost sweet flavor and aroma to fine Lagers.

Name: Ultra
Descr: Ultra: This is the latest release in the American Mittelfrueh series. Its aroma is often called "outstanding". Alpha acid levels tend to be low, but that is typical of the noble European varieties to which it is related. Alas, this one may be disappearing from commercial production for perhaps the very reason that made it great, its low acid level.

Name: Willamette
Descr: Willamette: A U.S. Fuggle hybrid with good bittering qualities.  A very versatile hop  with a light, fruity flavor and aroma.  Use it in almost any Ale style.

Name: Yakima Magmum
Descr: Yakima Magmum: Spicy, citrusy, super-high alpha bittering hop from the Pacific Northwest.
